qas.question: Why did rulers and governments in Europe form universities?

answers.text: to satisfy a European thirst for knowledge

plausible_answers.text: Princes and leaders of city governments

qas.question: Who perceived the benefits of rulers?

context: All over Europe <b4_0>rulers and <b11_0>city governments<b11_0/><b4_0/> began to create universities <a0_0><b8_0>to satisfy a European thirst for knowledge<b8_0/><a0_0/>, and the belief that society would benefit from the scholarly expertise generated from these institutions. <b6_0><b12_0>Princes<b6_0/> and leaders of <a3_0>city governments<b12_0/><a3_0/> perceived the potential benefits of having a scholarly expertise develop with the ability to address difficult problems and achieve desired ends. <b5_0>The emergence of <a1_0><b7_0><b9_0>humanism<b9_0/><b7_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/> was essential to this understanding of the possible utility of universities as well as the revival of interest in knowledge gained from ancient <a2_0><b10_0>Greek<b10_0/><a2_0/> texts.
